intro: Monanthotaxis trichocarpa, commonly known as the hairy-stemmed monanthotaxis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Araliaceae. It is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated margins and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. The plant is native to tropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments. It has a climbing habit and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain several seeds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
